definition: to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: Horseback riding and falconry popular pastimes.
sentences.chinese: 最受人喜爱的消遣是骑马和放鹰狩猎。

sentences.english: MicroChannel is a complete diversion from the original bus.
sentences.chinese: 微通道是从原来的公共汽车的完全的消遣。

sentences.english: Make sports and recreation training available to every interested church.
sentences.chinese: 将运动和具消遣性的训练带进教会。

sentences.english: Is blogging really a valuable pasttime?
sentences.chinese: 写博客真的是种有价值的消遣么？

sentences.english: They may also amuse themselves in the magnificent Workers Palace of Culture.
sentences.chinese: 他们也可以在富丽堂皇的工人文化宫里消遣娱乐。

sentences.english: For many Americans, sports do not just occupy the sidelines.
sentences.chinese: 对于多数美国人而言，运动并非只是一旁站的小消遣。

sentences.english: These dissipations make against your chance of success .
sentences.chinese: 这些不正当的消遣有损你成功的机会。

sentences.english: At last dancing had become more than an extra and entertaining frill .
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈也终于不再是供消遣娱乐的附加装饰。

sentences.english: I unwind at my favourite pub after sunset.
sentences.chinese: 太阳下山后我到喜欢的酒馆去消遣。

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer or staying in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 仅有的消遣是喝啤酒和在花园里种花草。

sentences.english: Her favorite pastimes are squash and dancing.
sentences.chinese: 她喜爱的消遣是回力球与跳舞。

sentences.english: Quarrelling E is one of her regular relaxations.
sentences.chinese: 吵架是她日常的消遣之一。

sentences.english: I decided to learn French just for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我学法语只是为了消遣。

sentences.english: Reflecting on the human condition was once a popular past-time.
sentences.chinese: 思考人类的处境曾是一种非常流行的消遣方式。

sentences.english: She diverted herself in singing and dancing.
Business sweetens pleasure, and labor sweetens rest.
sentences.chinese: 工作后消遣更愉快，劳动后休息更舒服。

definition: to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
leisure time (over a cup of tea, after a meal etc)
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
sth that people like to chat about/topic of idle conversation
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
